intro: Pourouma mollis subsp. triloba, commonly known as the Amazonian arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its large, arrow-shaped leaves that can grow up to 2 meters in length. The plant produces clusters of small, white flowers followed by edible, starchy tubers that are used in traditional cuisine. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found near water bodies in tropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and culinary purposes in the Amazon.
